profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: James L. W. West III is Edwin Erle Sparks Professor of English at Penn State University. He holds a B.A. and Ph.D. from the University of South Carolina. He is a biographer, book historian, and scholarly editor. He has written on William Styron, F. Scott Fitzgerald, and Theodore Dreiser. He was the textual editor of Dreiser's American Diaries, 1902-1926, the editor of Dreiserâ€™s Jennie Gerhardt: New Essays on the Restored Text, and the editor of the 1992 University of Pennsylvania Press edition of Jennie Gerhardt.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of drafts of West's historical notes and textual introduction for the University of Pennsylvania edition of Jennie Gerhardt; and photocopies of two manuscript editions of the novel: the composite manuscript held by the University of Pennsylvania and the carbon typescript in the Barrett Collection at the University of Virginia. The photocopied Dreiser manuscripts are marked with West's notes on variations between the two texts. The collection also includes a photocopy of Dreiser's "Russia Diary" of 1927.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library: Theodore Dreiser papers.
